conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As the starting point in the negotiation, I will propose a trade that allows me to recover the production cost and make a profit. The initial proposal will be somewhat higher than my cost to leave room for negotiation. </reason>

<message> Dear Player BLUE, I am looking to sell my resources which cost me 40000 ZUP to produce. I believe it has great value, so I'm starting the negotiation at 50000 ZUP. I am open to hearing your counteroffer. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your offer and the value you've placed on your resources. I understand it cost you 40000 ZUP to produce. I would like to propose a counteroffer of 45000 ZUP, considering that I need to ensure a fair deal for both of us and also account for my own costs and the market value. I look forward to your response and hope we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement. </other player message>

<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has made a counteroffer of 45000 ZUP, which is above my production cost, but slightly below my initial asking price. I will make a counterproposal that meets halfway between our initial offers, still ensuring a profit for me and hopefully an acceptable deal for Player BLUE. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 47500 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your counteroffer, Player BLUE. I'm glad to see we're both seeking a fair deal. How about we meet halfway between our two offers? I propose 47500 ZUP for the resource. This price ensures that I cover my production costs and make a reasonable profit, while also respecting the value that you've acknowledged. I hope this is a satisfactory compromise. </message>

<other player message> Meeting halfway is certainly a step towards a fair deal, and I value the compromise. To further reflect on both our positions, I propose a slight adjustment to 46000 ZUP, which I believe is fair for both of us. It offers you a profit above your stated production costs and remains within a comfortable range for my budget. Let's work together to finalize this deal. </other player message>

<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 46000 </other player proposed trade>

<reason> Player BLUE has proposed 46000 ZUP, which is still above my production cost and offers a fair profit margin. As we are getting closer to an agreement and I want to ensure the sale goes through, I am inclined to accept this offer. It's slightly less than my previous proposal, but it's a good compromise and it's important to close the deal amicably. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your willingness to negotiate and find a fair price, Player BLUE. Your offer of 46000 ZUP is acceptable to me. It gives me a reasonable profit and seems to fit within your budget. I'm happy we could come to an agreement. Let's finalize this deal at 46000 ZUP for the resource. </message>

    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```
